**Course Objectives**: This course focuses on developing and advancing students’ verbal and aural communication skills needed in academic settings. Main areas covered in class include: academic listening, critical thinking, critical listening, listening strategies applications and lecture note taking skills. During this semester, students will listen to and watch a variety of authentic visual and audio materials on various topics. In addition, the course seeks to develop students’ English discussion abilities and verbal communication skills in academic settings. 

**Grading Criteria**:

•    Attendance, Participation & In-Class Exercises 10%      

•    Listening Journals 40%

•    Midterm and Final Exam 50%

**Course Requirements**:

(1). Attendance- Students are expected to attend classes on a regular basis, and to arrive to class on time. (Tardiness and absences will affect your final grade for the course.) If you miss the class on more than two occasions without prior consent from the instructor, you will fail the course. Official documentation must be provided for an excused absence.   

(2). Active Participations- Language learning is an interactive process, therefore you are highly recommended to take active participations in class activities and tasks. Extra bonus points will be rewarded for those who make consistent effort in contributing to class discussions and group works.

(3). Additional Listening Practice – You will be required to do listening practices outside the classroom, and to complete a total of eight listening journals throughout the semester. For each listening assignment (journal), you could select to listen to/ watch from any one of the following types of programs: news (CNN, BBC), lectures, movies, speeches, debates, educational programs (National Geographic, Discovery…etc), and any other types of English TV programs that are of advanced level.     

Your listening journal should include the following information: your Chinese and English name, student number, number of the journal, date, the instructor’s name, title of the program, and source of the program. Please note that you should adhere to the assignment due dates (as specified on the course syllabus); late work will be marked down and will only be accepted within 3 school days of its specified due date.  

Textbooks:

•  Frazier, Laurie & Leeming, Shalle. (2007). Lecture Ready 3, Strategies for Academic Listening, Note-taking, and Discussion. New York, NY:Oxford.

•    Preiss, Sherry. (2009). North Star Listening and Speaking, Level 5 (Third Edition).White Plains, NY: Pearson Education.
